## DurableContext.parallel() method

Executes multiple branches with durable operations in parallel with optional concurrency control

**Signature:**

```typescript
parallel<TOutput>(name: string | undefined, branches: (ParallelFunc<TOutput, TLogger> | NamedParallelBranch<TOutput, TLogger>)[], config?: ParallelConfig<TOutput>): DurablePromise<BatchResult<TOutput>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

name

</td><td>

string \| undefined

</td><td>

Step name for tracking and debugging

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

branches

</td><td>

(ParallelFunc&lt;TOutput, TLogger&gt; \| NamedParallelBranch&lt;TOutput, TLogger&gt;)\[\]

</td><td>

Array of functions or named branches to execute in parallel (all must return same type)

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

config

</td><td>

ParallelConfig&lt;TOutput&gt;

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional configuration for concurrency and completion behavior

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DurablePromise](./durable-execution-sdk-js.durablepromise.md)<!-- -->&lt;[BatchResult](./durable-execution-sdk-js.batchresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;TOutput&gt;&gt;

## Example

```typescript
// Strict: all branches must return string
const results = await context.parallel<string>("parallel-operations", [
  async (ctx) => ctx.step(async () => "result1"),
  async (ctx) => ctx.step(async () => "result2"),
]);
```
